Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific sources or data to back up the statement.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there were cases of mass shootings involving black men, women, and undocumented immigrants in 2018, although no convictions had been made by July.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that none of the 154 mass shootings were perpetrated by black men, undocumented immigrants, or women, when there were cases involving these demographics.
Understate: The claim understates the involvement of black men in mass shootings by stating that none were involved, while the data source mentioned that two-thirds of cases with identified suspects involved black men.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by assuming that the absence of convictions automatically means that no mass shootings were perpetrated by certain demographics.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the claim, such as different definitions of mass shootings used by different data sources.
